level-up.name: tackle
level-up.description:
A physical attack in which the user charges and
slams into the target with its whole body.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

level-up.name: rollout
level-up.description:
The user continually rolls into the target over five
turns. It becomes more powerful each time it hits.
level-up.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  User is forced to use this move for five turns.  Power doubles every time this move is used in succession to a maximum of 16x, and resets to normal after the lock-in ends.  If this move misses or becomes unusable, the lock-in ends.

If the user has used defense curl since entering the field, this move has double power.

level-up.name: incinerate
level-up.description:
The user attacks opposing Pokémon with fire.
If a Pokémon is holding a certain item, such as a
Berry, the item becomes burned up and unusable.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is holding a berry, it's destroyed and cannot be used in response to this move.

level-up.name: rage
level-up.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Every time the user is hit after it uses this move but before its next action, its Attack raises by one stage.

level-up.name: fire-fang
level-up.description:
The user bites with flame-cloaked fangs. This may
also make the target flinch or leave it with a burn.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to burn the target and a separate 10% chance to make the target flinch.

level-up.name: headbutt
level-up.description:
The user sticks out its head and attacks by charging
straight into the target. This may also make the
target flinch.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

level-up.name: uproar
level-up.description:
The user attacks in an uproar for three turns.
During that time, no Pokémon can fall asleep.
level-up.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  User is forced to use this move for 2–5 turns, selected at random.  All Pokémon on the field wake up, and none can fall to sleep until the lock-in ends.

Pokémon cannot use rest during this effect.

This move cannot be selected by sleep talk.

level-up.name: facade
level-up.description:
This attack move doubles its power if the user is
poisoned, burned, or paralyzed.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If the user is burned, paralyzed, or poisoned, this move has double power.

level-up.name: fire-punch
level-up.description:
The target is punched with a fiery fist. This may also
leave the target with a burn.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to burn the target.

level-up.name: work-up
level-up.description:
The user is roused, and its Attack and Sp. Atk
stats increase.
level-up.effect: Raises the user's Attack and Special Attack by one stage each.

level-up.name: thrash
level-up.description:
The user rampages and attacks for two to three
turns. The user then becomes confused.
level-up.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  User is forced to attack with this move for 2–3 turns,selected at random.  After the last hit, the user becomes confused.

safeguard does not protect against the confusion from this move.

level-up.name: belly-drum
level-up.description:
The user maximizes its Attack stat in exchange for
HP equal to half its max HP.
level-up.effect: User pays half its max HP to raise its Attack to +6 stages.  If the user cannot pay the HP cost, this move will fail.

level-up.name: flare-blitz
level-up.description:
The user cloaks itself in fire and charges the target.
This also damages the user quite a lot. This attack
may leave the target with a burn.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/3 the damage it inflicts in recoil.  Has a 10% chance to burn the target.  Frozen Pokémon may use this move, in which case they will thaw.

level-up.name: taunt
level-up.description:
The target is taunted into a rage that allows it to use
only attack moves for three turns.
level-up.effect:
Target is forced to only use damaging moves for the next 3–5 turns, selected at random.  Moves that select other moves not known in advance do not count as damaging.

assist, copycat, me first, metronome, mirror move, and sleep talk do not directly inflict damage and thus may not be used.

bide, counter, endeavor, metal burst, and mirror coat are allowed.

level-up.name: superpower
level-up.description:
The user attacks the target with great power.
However, this also lowers the user’s Attack and
Defense stats.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage, then lowers the user's Attack and Defense by one stage each.

level-up.name: overheat
level-up.description:
The user attacks the target at full power. The attack’s
recoil harshly lowers the user’s Sp. Atk stat.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage, then lowers the user's Special Attack by two stages.

egg.name: take-down
egg.description:
A reckless, full-body charge attack for slamming into
the target. This also damages the user a little.
egg.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/4 the damage it inflicts in recoil.

egg.name: focus-energy
egg.description:
The user takes a deep breath and focuses so that
critical hits land more easily.
egg.effect:
User's critical hit rate is two levels higher until it leaves the field.  If the user has already used focus energy since entering the field, this move will fail.

This effect is passed on by baton pass.

egg.name: flame-wheel
egg.description:
The user cloaks itself in fire and charges at the
target. This may also leave the target with a burn.
egg.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to burn the target.  Frozen Pokémon may use this move, in which case they will thaw.

egg.name: endure
egg.description:
The user endures any attack with at least 1 HP.
Its chance of failing rises if it is used in succession.
egg.effect:
The user's HP cannot be lowered below 1 by any means for the remainder of this turn.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick guard, or wide guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

egg.name: sleep-talk
egg.description:
While it is asleep, the user randomly uses one of the
moves it knows.
egg.effect:
Only usable if the user is sleeping.  Randomly selects and uses one of the user's other three moves.  Use of the selected move requires and costs 0 PP.

This move will not select assist, bide, bounce, chatter, copycat, dig, dive, fly, focus punch, me first, metronome, mirror move, shadow force, skull bash, sky attack, sky drop, sleep talk, solar beam, razor wind, or uproar.

If the selected move requires a recharge turn—i.e., one of blast burn, frenzy plant, giga impact, hydro cannon, hyper beam, roar of time, or rock wrecker—and the user is still sleeping next turn, then it's forced to use this move again and pay another PP for the recharge turn.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist, metronome, or sleep talk.

egg.name: encore
egg.description:
The user compels the target to keep using the move
it encored for three turns.
egg.effect:
The next 4–8 times (selected at random) the target attempts to move, it is forced to repeat its last used move.  If the selected move allows the trainer to select a target, an opponent will be selected at random each turn.  If the target is prevented from using the selected move by some other effect, struggle will be used instead.  This effect ends if the selected move runs out of PP.

If the target hasn't used a move since entering the field, if it tried to use a move this turn and failed, if it does not know the selected move, or if the selected move has 0 PP remaining, this move will fail.  If the target's last used move was encore, mimic, mirror move, sketch, struggle, or transform, this move will fail.

egg.name: focus-punch
egg.description:
The user focuses its mind before launching a punch.
This move fails if the user is hit before it is used.
egg.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  If the user takes damage this turn before hitting, this move will fail.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist, metronome, or sleep talk.

egg.name: yawn
egg.description:
The user lets loose a huge yawn that lulls the target
into falling asleep on the next turn.
egg.effect:
Puts the target to sleep at the end of the next turn.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.  If the target leaves the field, this effect is canceled.  If the target has a status effect when this move is used, this move will fail.

If the target is protected by safeguard when this move is used, this move will fail.

insomnia and vital spirit prevent the sleep if the target has either at the end of the next turn, but will not cause this move to fail on use.

egg.name: hammer-arm
egg.description:
The user swings and hits with its strong, heavy fist.
It lowers the user’s Speed, however.
egg.effect: Inflicts regular damage, then lowers the user's Speed by one stage.

tutor.name: fire-punch
tutor.description:
The target is punched with a fiery fist. This may also
leave the target with a burn.
tutor.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to burn the target.

tutor.name: snore
tutor.description:
This attack can be used only if the user is asleep.
The harsh noise may also make the target flinch.
tutor.effect: Only usable if the user is sleeping.  Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

tutor.name: sleep-talk
tutor.description:
While it is asleep, the user randomly uses one of the
moves it knows.
tutor.effect:
Only usable if the user is sleeping.  Randomly selects and uses one of the user's other three moves.  Use of the selected move requires and costs 0 PP.

This move will not select assist, bide, bounce, chatter, copycat, dig, dive, fly, focus punch, me first, metronome, mirror move, shadow force, skull bash, sky attack, sky drop, sleep talk, solar beam, razor wind, or uproar.

If the selected move requires a recharge turn—i.e., one of blast burn, frenzy plant, giga impact, hydro cannon, hyper beam, roar of time, or rock wrecker—and the user is still sleeping next turn, then it's forced to use this move again and pay another PP for the recharge turn.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist, metronome, or sleep talk.

tutor.description:
The user attacks in an uproar for three turns.
During that time, no Pokémon can fall asleep.
tutor.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  User is forced to use this move for 2–5 turns, selected at random.  All Pokémon on the field wake up, and none can fall to sleep until the lock-in ends.

Pokémon cannot use rest during this effect.

This move cannot be selected by sleep talk.

tutor.name: heat-wave
tutor.description:
The user attacks by exhaling hot breath on opposing
Pokémon. This may also leave those Pokémon with
a burn.
tutor.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to burn the target.

tutor.name: superpower
tutor.description:
The user attacks the target with great power.
However, this also lowers the user’s Attack and
Defense stats.
tutor.effect: Inflicts regular damage, then lowers the user's Attack and Defense by one stage each.

tutor.name: endeavor
tutor.description:
This attack move cuts down the target’s HP to equal
the user’s HP.
tutor.effect: Inflicts exactly enough damage to lower the target's HP to equal the user's.  If the target's HP is not higher than the user's, this move has no effect.  Type immunity applies, but other type effects are ignored.  This effect counts as damage for moves that respond to damage.

tutor.name: zen-headbutt
tutor.description:
The user focuses its willpower to its head and
attacks the target. This may also make the
target flinch.
tutor.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 20% chance to make the target flinch.

machine.name: strength
machine.description:
The target is slugged with a punch thrown at
maximum power.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

machine.name: roar
machine.description:
The target is scared off, and a different Pokémon is
dragged out. In the wild, this ends a battle against a
single Pokémon.
machine.effect:
Switches the target out for another of its trainer's Pokémon selected at random.  Wild battles end immediately.

Doesn't affect Pokémon with suction cups or under the effect of ingrain.

machine.name: toxic
machine.description:
A move that leaves the target badly poisoned.
Its poison damage worsens every turn.
machine.effect: Badly poisons the target.  Never misses when used by a poison-type Pokémon.

machine.name: hidden-power
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's IVs.

Power is given by `x * 40 / 63 + 30`.  `x` is obtained by arranging bit 1 from the IV for each of Special Defense, Special Attack, Speed, Defense, Attack, and HP in that order.  (Bit 1 is 1 if the IV is of the form `4n + 2` or `4n + 3`.  `x` is then 64 * Special Defense IV bit 1, plus 32 * Special Attack IV bit 1, etc.)

Power is always between 30 and 70, inclusive.  Average power is 49.5.

Type is given by `y * 15 / 63`, where `y` is similar to `x` above, except constructed from bit 0.  (Bit 0 is 1 if the IV is odd.)  The result is looked up in the following table.

Value | Type
----: | --------
    0 | fighting
    1 | flying
    2 | poison
    3 | ground
    4 | rock
    5 | bug
    6 | ghost
    7 | steel
    8 | fire
    9 | water
   10 | grass
   11 | electric
   12 | psychic
   13 | ice
   14 | dragon
   15 | dark

This move thus cannot be normal.  Most other types have an equal 1/16 chance to be selected, given random IVs.  However, due to the flooring used here, bug, fighting, and grass appear 5/64 of the time, and dark only 1/64 of the time.

machine.name: sunny-day
machine.description:
The user intensifies the sun for five turns, powering
up Fire-type moves. It lowers the power of
Water-type moves.
machine.effect:
Changes the weather to sunshine for five turns, during which fire moves inflict 50% extra damage, and water moves inflict half damage.

If the user is holding heat rock, this effect lasts for eight turns.

Pokémon cannot become frozen.

thunder has 50% accuracy.

solar beam skips its charge turn.

moonlight, morning sun, and synthesis heal 2/3 of the user's max HP.

Pokémon with chlorophyll have doubled original Speed.

Pokémon with forecast become fire.

Pokémon with leaf guard are not affected by major status effects.

Pokémon with flower gift change form; every Pokémon on their side of the field have their original Attack and Special Attack increased by 50%.

Pokémon with dry skin lose 1/8 max HP at the end of each turn.

Pokémon with solar power have their original Special Attack raised by 50% but lose 1/8 their max HP at the end of each turn.

machine.name: taunt
machine.description:
The target is taunted into a rage that allows it to use
only attack moves for three turns.
machine.effect:
Target is forced to only use damaging moves for the next 3–5 turns, selected at random.  Moves that select other moves not known in advance do not count as damaging.

assist, copycat, me first, metronome, mirror move, and sleep talk do not directly inflict damage and thus may not be used.

bide, counter, endeavor, metal burst, and mirror coat are allowed.

machine.name: protect
machine.description:
This move enables the user to protect itself from
all attacks. Its chance of failing rises if it is used
in succession.
machine.effect:
No moves will hit the user for the remainder of this turn.  If the user is last to act this turn, this move will fail.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick guard, or wide guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

lock on, mind reader, and no guard provide a (100 – accuracy)% chance for moves to break through this move.  This does not apply to one-hit KO moves (fissure, guillotine, horn drill, and sheer cold); those are always blocked by this move.

thunder during rain dance and blizzard during hail have a 30% chance to break through this move.

The following effects are not prevented by this move:

* acupressure from an ally
* curse's curse effect
* Delayed damage from doom desire and future sight; however, these moves will be prevented if they are used this turn
* feint, which will also end this move's protection after it hits
* imprison
* perish song
* shadow force
* Moves that merely copy the user, such as transform or psych up

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

machine.name: frustration
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases inversely with happiness, given by `(255 - happiness) * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

machine.name: solar-beam
machine.description:
In this two-turn attack, the user gathers light, then
blasts a bundled beam on the next turn.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  User charges for one turn before attacking.

During sunny day, the charge turn is skipped.

During hail, rain dance, or sandstorm, power is halved.

This move cannot be selected by sleep talk.

machine.name: return
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with happiness, given by `happiness * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

machine.name: dig
machine.description:
The user burrows into the ground, then attacks on
the next turn.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  User digs underground for one turn, becoming immune to attack, and hits on the second turn.

During the immune turn, earthquake, fissure, and magnitude still hit the user normally, and their power is doubled if appropriate.

The user may be hit during its immune turn if under the effect of lock on, mind reader, or no guard.

This move cannot be selected by sleep talk.

machine.name: brick-break
machine.description:
The user attacks with a swift chop. It can also break
barriers, such as Light Screen and Reflect.
machine.effect: Destroys any light screen or reflect on the target's side of the field, then inflicts regular damage.

machine.name: double-team
machine.description:
By moving rapidly, the user makes illusory copies of
itself to raise its evasiveness.
machine.effect: Raises the user's evasion by one stage.

machine.name: flamethrower
machine.description:
The target is scorched with an intense blast of fire.
This may also leave the target with a burn.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to burn the target.

machine.name: fire-blast
machine.description:
The target is attacked with an intense blast of
all-consuming fire. This may also leave the target
with a burn.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to burn the target.

machine.name: rock-tomb
machine.description:
Boulders are hurled at the target. This also lowers
the target’s Speed stat by preventing its movement.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Speed by one stage.

machine.name: facade
machine.description:
This attack move doubles its power if the user is
poisoned, burned, or paralyzed.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If the user is burned, paralyzed, or poisoned, this move has double power.

machine.name: flame-charge
machine.description:
Cloaking itself in flame, the user attacks the target.
Then, building up more power, the user raises its
Speed stat.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Raises the user's Speed by one stage.

machine.name: rest
machine.description:
The user goes to sleep for two turns. This fully
restores the user’s HP and heals any
status conditions.
machine.effect:
User falls to sleep and immediately regains all its HP.  If the user has another major status effect, sleep will replace it.  The user will always wake up after two turns, or one turn with early bird.

This move fails if the Pokémon cannot fall asleep due to uproar, insomnia, or vital spirit.  It also fails if the Pokémon is at full health or is already asleep.

machine.name: attract
machine.description:
If it is the opposite gender of the user, the target
becomes infatuated and less likely to attack.
machine.effect: Causes the target to fall in love with the user, giving it a 50% chance to do nothing each turn.  If the user and target are the same gender, or either is genderless, this move will fail.  If either Pokémon leaves the field, this effect ends.

machine.name: thief
machine.description:
The user attacks and steals the target’s held item
simultaneously. The user can’t steal anything if it
already holds an item.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is holding an item and the user is not, the user will permanently take the item.  Damage is still inflicted if an item cannot be taken.

Pokémon with sticky hold or multitype are immune to the item theft effect.

The target cannot recover its item with recycle.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

machine.name: round
machine.description:
The user attacks the target with a song. Others can
join in the Round to increase the power of
the attack.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If round has already been used this turn, this move's power is doubled.  After this move is used, any other Pokémon using it this turn will immediately do so (in the order they would otherwise act), regardless of Speed or priority.  Pokémon using other moves will then continue to act as usual.

machine.name: overheat
machine.description:
The user attacks the target at full power. The attack’s
recoil harshly lowers the user’s Sp. Atk stat.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage, then lowers the user's Special Attack by two stages.

machine.name: fling
machine.description:
The user flings its held item at the target to attack.
This move’s power and effects depend on the item.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's held item.  The item is consumed.  If the user is not holding an item, or its item has no set type and power, this move will fail.

This move ignores sticky hold.

If the user is under the effect of embargo, this move will fail.

machine.name: incinerate
machine.description:
The user attacks opposing Pokémon with fire.
If a Pokémon is holding a certain item, such as a
Berry, the item becomes burned up and unusable.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is holding a berry, it's destroyed and cannot be used in response to this move.

machine.name: will-o-wisp
machine.description:
The user shoots a sinister flame at the target to inflict
a burn.
machine.effect: Burns the target.

machine.name: gyro-ball
machine.description:
The user tackles the target with a high-speed spin.
The slower the user compared to the target, the
greater the move’s power.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with the target's current Speed compared to the user, given by `1 + 25 * target Speed / user Speed`, capped at 150.

machine.name: rock-slide
machine.description:
Large boulders are hurled at opposing Pokémon to
inflict damage. This may also make the opposing
Pokémon flinch.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

machine.name: work-up
machine.description:
The user is roused, and its Attack and Sp. Atk
stats increase.
machine.effect: Raises the user's Attack and Special Attack by one stage each.

machine.name: grass-knot
machine.description:
The user snares the target with grass and trips it.
The heavier the target, the greater the
move’s power.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with the target's weight in kilograms, to a maximum of 120.

Target's weight | Power
--------------- | ----:
Up to 10kg      |    20
Up to 25kg      |    40
Up to 50kg      |    60
Up to 100kg     |    80
Up to 200kg     |   100
Above 200kg     |   120

machine.name: swagger
machine.description:
The user enrages and confuses the target. However,
this also sharply raises the target’s Attack stat.
machine.effect: Raises the target's Attack by two stages, then confuses it.  If the target's Attack cannot be raised by two stages, the confusion is not applied.

machine.name: u-turn
machine.description:
After making its attack, the user rushes back to
switch places with a party Pokémon in waiting.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage, then the user immediately switches out, and the trainer selects a replacement Pokémon from the party.  If the target faints from this attack, the user's trainer selects the new Pokémon to send out first.  If the user is the last Pokémon in its party that can battle, it will not switch out.

The user may be hit by pursuit when it switches out, if it has been targeted and pursuit has not yet been used.

This move may be used even if the user is under the effect of ingrain.  ingrain's effect will end.

machine.name: substitute
machine.description:
The user creates a substitute for itself using some of
its HP. The substitute serves as the user’s decoy.
machine.effect:
Transfers 1/4 the user's max HP into a doll that absorbs damage and causes most negative move effects to fail.  If the user leaves the field, the doll will vanish.  If the user cannot pay the HP cost, this move will fail.

The doll takes damage as normal, using the user's stats and types, and will break when its HP reaches zero.  Self-inflicted damage from confusion or recoil is not absorbed.  Healing effects from opponents ignore the doll and heal the user as normal.  Moves that work based on the user's HP still do so; the doll's HP does not influence any move.

The doll will block major status effects, confusion, and flinching.  The effects of smelling salts and wake up slap do not trigger against a doll, even if the Pokémon behind the doll has the appropriate major status effect.  Multi-turn trapping moves like wrap will hit the doll for their regular damage, but the multi-turn trapping and damage effects will not activate.

Moves blocked or damage absorbed by the doll do not count as hitting the user or inflicting damage for any effects that respond to such, e.g., avalanche, counter, or a rowap berry.  magic coat still works as normal, even against moves the doll would block.  Opposing Pokémon that damage the doll with a leech move like absorb are healed as normal.

It will also block acupressure, block, the curse effect of curse, dream eater, embargo, flatter, gastro acid, grudge, heal block, leech seed, lock on, mean look, mimic, mind reader, nightmare, pain split, psycho shift, spider web, sketch, swagger, switcheroo, trick, worry seed, and yawn.  A Pokémon affected by yawn before summoning the doll will still fall to sleep.

The doll blocks intimidate, but all other abilities act as though the doll did not exist.  If the user has an ability that absorbs moves of a certain type for HP (such as volt absorb absorbing thunder wave), such moves will not be blocked.

life orb and berries that cause confusion still work as normal, but their respective HP loss and confusion are absorbed/blocked by the doll.

The user is still vulnerable to damage inflicted when entering or leaving the field, such as by pursuit or spikes; however, the doll will block the poison effect of toxic spikes.

The doll is passed on by baton pass.  It keeps its existing HP, but uses the replacement Pokémon's stats and types for damage calculation.

All other effects work as normal.

machine.name: rock-smash
machine.description:
The user attacks with a punch. This may also lower
the target’s Defense stat.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 50% chance to lower the target's Defense by one stage.

The user bites with flame-cloaked fangs. This may
also make the target flinch or leave it with a burn.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to burn the target and a separate 10% chance to make the target flinch.

level-up.name: headbutt
level-up.description:
The user sticks out its head and attacks by charging
straight into the target. This may also make the
target flinch.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

level-up.name: uproar
level-up.description:
The user attacks in an uproar for three turns.
During that time, no Pokémon can fall asleep.
level-up.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  User is forced to use this move for 2–5 turns, selected at random.  All Pokémon on the field wake up, and none can fall to sleep until the lock-in ends.

Pokémon cannot use rest during this effect.

This move cannot be selected by sleep talk.

level-up.name: facade
level-up.description:
This attack move doubles its power if the user is
poisoned, burned, or paralyzed.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If the user is burned, paralyzed, or poisoned, this move has double power.

level-up.name: fire-punch
level-up.description:
The target is punched with a fiery fist. This may also
leave the target with a burn.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to burn the target.

level-up.name: work-up
level-up.description:
The user is roused, and its Attack and Sp. Atk
stats increase.
level-up.effect: Raises the user's Attack and Special Attack by one stage each.

level-up.name: thrash
level-up.description:
The user rampages and attacks for two to three
turns. The user then becomes confused.
level-up.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  User is forced to attack with this move for 2–3 turns,selected at random.  After the last hit, the user becomes confused.

safeguard does not protect against the confusion from this move.

level-up.name: belly-drum
level-up.description:
The user maximizes its Attack stat in exchange for
HP equal to half its max HP.
level-up.effect: User pays half its max HP to raise its Attack to +6 stages.  If the user cannot pay the HP cost, this move will fail.

level-up.name: flare-blitz
level-up.description:
The user cloaks itself in fire and charges the target.
This also damages the user quite a lot. This attack
may leave the target with a burn.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/3 the damage it inflicts in recoil.  Has a 10% chance to burn the target.  Frozen Pokémon may use this move, in which case they will thaw.

level-up.name: taunt
level-up.description:
The target is taunted into a rage that allows it to use
only attack moves for three turns.
level-up.effect:
Target is forced to only use damaging moves for the next 3–5 turns, selected at random.  Moves that select other moves not known in advance do not count as damaging.

assist, copycat, me first, metronome, mirror move, and sleep talk do not directly inflict damage and thus may not be used.

bide, counter, endeavor, metal burst, and mirror coat are allowed.

level-up.name: superpower
level-up.description:
The user attacks the target with great power.
However, this also lowers the user’s Attack and
Defense stats.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage, then lowers the user's Attack and Defense by one stage each.

level-up.name: overheat
level-up.description:
The user attacks the target at full power. The attack’s
recoil harshly lowers the user’s Sp. Atk stat.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage, then lowers the user's Special Attack by two stages.

egg.name: take-down
egg.description:
A reckless, full-body charge attack for slamming into
the target. This also damages the user a little.
egg.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/4 the damage it inflicts in recoil.

egg.name: focus-energy
egg.description:
The user takes a deep breath and focuses so that
critical hits land more easily.
egg.effect:
User's critical hit rate is two levels higher until it leaves the field.  If the user has already used focus energy since entering the field, this move will fail.

This effect is passed on by baton pass.

egg.name: flame-wheel
egg.description:
The user cloaks itself in fire and charges at the
target. This may also leave the target with a burn.
egg.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to burn the target.  Frozen Pokémon may use this move, in which case they will thaw.

egg.name: endure
egg.description:
The user endures any attack with at least 1 HP.
Its chance of failing rises if it is used in succession.
egg.effect:
The user's HP cannot be lowered below 1 by any means for the remainder of this turn.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick guard, or wide guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

egg.name: sleep-talk
egg.description:
While it is asleep, the user randomly uses one of the
moves it knows.
egg.effect:
Only usable if the user is sleeping.  Randomly selects and uses one of the user's other three moves.  Use of the selected move requires and costs 0 PP.

This move will not select assist, bide, bounce, chatter, copycat, dig, dive, fly, focus punch, me first, metronome, mirror move, shadow force, skull bash, sky attack, sky drop, sleep talk, solar beam, razor wind, or uproar.

If the selected move requires a recharge turn—i.e., one of blast burn, frenzy plant, giga impact, hydro cannon, hyper beam, roar of time, or rock wrecker—and the user is still sleeping next turn, then it's forced to use this move again and pay another PP for the recharge turn.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist, metronome, or sleep talk.

egg.name: encore
egg.description:
The user compels the target to keep using the move
it encored for three turns.
egg.effect:
The next 4–8 times (selected at random) the target attempts to move, it is forced to repeat its last used move.  If the selected move allows the trainer to select a target, an opponent will be selected at random each turn.  If the target is prevented from using the selected move by some other effect, struggle will be used instead.  This effect ends if the selected move runs out of PP.

If the target hasn't used a move since entering the field, if it tried to use a move this turn and failed, if it does not know the selected move, or if the selected move has 0 PP remaining, this move will fail.  If the target's last used move was encore, mimic, mirror move, sketch, struggle, or transform, this move will fail.

egg.name: focus-punch
egg.description:
The user focuses its mind before launching a punch.
This move fails if the user is hit before it is used.
egg.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  If the user takes damage this turn before hitting, this move will fail.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist, metronome, or sleep talk.

egg.name: yawn
egg.description:
The user lets loose a huge yawn that lulls the target
into falling asleep on the next turn.
egg.effect:
Puts the target to sleep at the end of the next turn.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.  If the target leaves the field, this effect is canceled.  If the target has a status effect when this move is used, this move will fail.

If the target is protected by safeguard when this move is used, this move will fail.

insomnia and vital spirit prevent the sleep if the target has either at the end of the next turn, but will not cause this move to fail on use.

egg.name: snatch
egg.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
egg.effect:
The next time a Pokémon uses a beneficial move on itself or itself and its ally this turn, the user of this move will steal the move and use it itself.  Moves which may be stolen by this move are identified by the "snatchable" flag.

If two Pokémon use this move on the same turn, the faster Pokémon will steal the first beneficial move, and the slower Pokémon will then steal it again—thus, only the slowest Pokémon using this move ultimately gains a stolen move's effect.

If the user steals psych up, it will target the Pokémon that used psych up.  If the user was the original target of psych up, and the Pokémon that originally used it's affected by pressure, it will only lose 1 PP.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist or metronome.

egg.name: hammer-arm
egg.description:
The user swings and hits with its strong, heavy fist.
It lowers the user’s Speed, however.
egg.effect: Inflicts regular damage, then lowers the user's Speed by one stage.

machine.name: strength
machine.description:
The target is slugged with a punch thrown at
maximum power.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

machine.name: roar
machine.description:
The target is scared off, and a different Pokémon is
dragged out. In the wild, this ends a battle against a
single Pokémon.
machine.effect:
Switches the target out for another of its trainer's Pokémon selected at random.  Wild battles end immediately.

Doesn't affect Pokémon with suction cups or under the effect of ingrain.

machine.name: toxic
machine.description:
A move that leaves the target badly poisoned.
Its poison damage worsens every turn.
machine.effect: Badly poisons the target.  Never misses when used by a poison-type Pokémon.

machine.name: hidden-power
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's IVs.

Power is given by `x * 40 / 63 + 30`.  `x` is obtained by arranging bit 1 from the IV for each of Special Defense, Special Attack, Speed, Defense, Attack, and HP in that order.  (Bit 1 is 1 if the IV is of the form `4n + 2` or `4n + 3`.  `x` is then 64 * Special Defense IV bit 1, plus 32 * Special Attack IV bit 1, etc.)

Power is always between 30 and 70, inclusive.  Average power is 49.5.

Type is given by `y * 15 / 63`, where `y` is similar to `x` above, except constructed from bit 0.  (Bit 0 is 1 if the IV is odd.)  The result is looked up in the following table.

Value | Type
----: | --------
    0 | fighting
    1 | flying
    2 | poison
    3 | ground
    4 | rock
    5 | bug
    6 | ghost
    7 | steel
    8 | fire
    9 | water
   10 | grass
   11 | electric
   12 | psychic
   13 | ice
   14 | dragon
   15 | dark

This move thus cannot be normal.  Most other types have an equal 1/16 chance to be selected, given random IVs.  However, due to the flooring used here, bug, fighting, and grass appear 5/64 of the time, and dark only 1/64 of the time.

machine.name: confide
machine.description:
The user tells the target a secret, and the target
loses its ability to concentrate. This lowers
the target’s Sp. Atk stat.
machine.effect: Lowers the target's Special Attack by one stage.

machine.name: sunny-day
machine.description:
The user intensifies the sun for five turns, powering
up Fire-type moves. It lowers the power of
Water-type moves.
machine.effect:
Changes the weather to sunshine for five turns, during which fire moves inflict 50% extra damage, and water moves inflict half damage.

If the user is holding heat rock, this effect lasts for eight turns.

Pokémon cannot become frozen.

thunder has 50% accuracy.

solar beam skips its charge turn.

moonlight, morning sun, and synthesis heal 2/3 of the user's max HP.

Pokémon with chlorophyll have doubled original Speed.

Pokémon with forecast become fire.

Pokémon with leaf guard are not affected by major status effects.

Pokémon with flower gift change form; every Pokémon on their side of the field have their original Attack and Special Attack increased by 50%.

Pokémon with dry skin lose 1/8 max HP at the end of each turn.

Pokémon with solar power have their original Special Attack raised by 50% but lose 1/8 their max HP at the end of each turn.

machine.name: taunt
machine.description:
The target is taunted into a rage that allows it to use
only attack moves for three turns.
machine.effect:
Target is forced to only use damaging moves for the next 3–5 turns, selected at random.  Moves that select other moves not known in advance do not count as damaging.

assist, copycat, me first, metronome, mirror move, and sleep talk do not directly inflict damage and thus may not be used.

bide, counter, endeavor, metal burst, and mirror coat are allowed.

machine.name: protect
machine.description:
This move enables the user to protect itself from
all attacks. Its chance of failing rises if it is used
in succession.
machine.effect:
No moves will hit the user for the remainder of this turn.  If the user is last to act this turn, this move will fail.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick guard, or wide guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

lock on, mind reader, and no guard provide a (100 – accuracy)% chance for moves to break through this move.  This does not apply to one-hit KO moves (fissure, guillotine, horn drill, and sheer cold); those are always blocked by this move.

thunder during rain dance and blizzard during hail have a 30% chance to break through this move.

The following effects are not prevented by this move:

* acupressure from an ally
* curse's curse effect
* Delayed damage from doom desire and future sight; however, these moves will be prevented if they are used this turn
* feint, which will also end this move's protection after it hits
* imprison
* perish song
* shadow force
* Moves that merely copy the user, such as transform or psych up

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

machine.name: frustration
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases inversely with happiness, given by `(255 - happiness) * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

machine.name: solar-beam
machine.description:
In this two-turn attack, the user gathers light, then
blasts a bundled beam on the next turn.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  User charges for one turn before attacking.

During sunny day, the charge turn is skipped.

During hail, rain dance, or sandstorm, power is halved.

This move cannot be selected by sleep talk.

machine.name: return
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with happiness, given by `happiness * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

machine.name: dig
machine.description:
The user burrows into the ground, then attacks on
the next turn.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  User digs underground for one turn, becoming immune to attack, and hits on the second turn.

During the immune turn, earthquake, fissure, and magnitude still hit the user normally, and their power is doubled if appropriate.

The user may be hit during its immune turn if under the effect of lock on, mind reader, or no guard.

This move cannot be selected by sleep talk.

machine.name: brick-break
machine.description:
The user attacks with a swift chop. It can also break
barriers, such as Light Screen and Reflect.
machine.effect: Destroys any light screen or reflect on the target's side of the field, then inflicts regular damage.

machine.name: double-team
machine.description:
By moving rapidly, the user makes illusory copies of
itself to raise its evasiveness.
machine.effect: Raises the user's evasion by one stage.

machine.name: flamethrower
machine.description:
The target is scorched with an intense blast of fire.
This may also leave the target with a burn.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to burn the target.

machine.name: fire-blast
machine.description:
The target is attacked with an intense blast of
all-consuming fire. This may also leave the target
with a burn.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to burn the target.

machine.name: rock-tomb
machine.description:
Boulders are hurled at the target. This also lowers
the target’s Speed stat by preventing its movement.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Speed by one stage.

machine.name: facade
machine.description:
This attack move doubles its power if the user is
poisoned, burned, or paralyzed.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If the user is burned, paralyzed, or poisoned, this move has double power.

machine.name: flame-charge
machine.description:
Cloaking itself in flame, the user attacks the target.
Then, building up more power, the user raises its
Speed stat.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Raises the user's Speed by one stage.

machine.name: rest
machine.description:
The user goes to sleep for two turns. This fully
restores the user’s HP and heals any
status conditions.
machine.effect:
User falls to sleep and immediately regains all its HP.  If the user has another major status effect, sleep will replace it.  The user will always wake up after two turns, or one turn with early bird.

This move fails if the Pokémon cannot fall asleep due to uproar, insomnia, or vital spirit.  It also fails if the Pokémon is at full health or is already asleep.

machine.name: attract
machine.description:
If it is the opposite gender of the user, the target
becomes infatuated and less likely to attack.
machine.effect: Causes the target to fall in love with the user, giving it a 50% chance to do nothing each turn.  If the user and target are the same gender, or either is genderless, this move will fail.  If either Pokémon leaves the field, this effect ends.

machine.name: thief
machine.description:
The user attacks and steals the target’s held item
simultaneously. The user can’t steal anything if it
already holds an item.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is holding an item and the user is not, the user will permanently take the item.  Damage is still inflicted if an item cannot be taken.

Pokémon with sticky hold or multitype are immune to the item theft effect.

The target cannot recover its item with recycle.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

machine.name: round
machine.description:
The user attacks the target with a song. Others can
join in the Round to increase the power of
the attack.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If round has already been used this turn, this move's power is doubled.  After this move is used, any other Pokémon using it this turn will immediately do so (in the order they would otherwise act), regardless of Speed or priority.  Pokémon using other moves will then continue to act as usual.

machine.name: overheat
machine.description:
The user attacks the target at full power. The attack’s
recoil harshly lowers the user’s Sp. Atk stat.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage, then lowers the user's Special Attack by two stages.

machine.name: fling
machine.description:
The user flings its held item at the target to attack.
This move’s power and effects depend on the item.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's held item.  The item is consumed.  If the user is not holding an item, or its item has no set type and power, this move will fail.

This move ignores sticky hold.

If the user is under the effect of embargo, this move will fail.

machine.name: incinerate
machine.description:
The user attacks opposing Pokémon with fire.
If a Pokémon is holding a certain item, such as a
Berry, the item becomes burned up and unusable.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is holding a berry, it's destroyed and cannot be used in response to this move.

machine.name: will-o-wisp
machine.description:
The user shoots a sinister flame at the target to inflict
a burn.
machine.effect: Burns the target.

machine.name: gyro-ball
machine.description:
The user tackles the target with a high-speed spin.
The slower the user compared to the target, the
greater the move’s power.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with the target's current Speed compared to the user, given by `1 + 25 * target Speed / user Speed`, capped at 150.

machine.name: rock-slide
machine.description:
Large boulders are hurled at opposing Pokémon to
inflict damage. This may also make the opposing
Pokémon flinch.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

machine.name: grass-knot
machine.description:
The user snares the target with grass and trips it.
The heavier the target, the greater the
move’s power.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with the target's weight in kilograms, to a maximum of 120.

Target's weight | Power
--------------- | ----:
Up to 10kg      |    20
Up to 25kg      |    40
Up to 50kg      |    60
Up to 100kg     |    80
Up to 200kg     |   100
Above 200kg     |   120

machine.name: swagger
machine.description:
The user enrages and confuses the target. However,
this also sharply raises the target’s Attack stat.
machine.effect: Raises the target's Attack by two stages, then confuses it.  If the target's Attack cannot be raised by two stages, the confusion is not applied.

machine.name: sleep-talk
machine.description:
While it is asleep, the user randomly uses one of the
moves it knows.
machine.effect:
Only usable if the user is sleeping.  Randomly selects and uses one of the user's other three moves.  Use of the selected move requires and costs 0 PP.

This move will not select assist, bide, bounce, chatter, copycat, dig, dive, fly, focus punch, me first, metronome, mirror move, shadow force, skull bash, sky attack, sky drop, sleep talk, solar beam, razor wind, or uproar.

If the selected move requires a recharge turn—i.e., one of blast burn, frenzy plant, giga impact, hydro cannon, hyper beam, roar of time, or rock wrecker—and the user is still sleeping next turn, then it's forced to use this move again and pay another PP for the recharge turn.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist, metronome, or sleep talk.

machine.name: u-turn
machine.description:
After making its attack, the user rushes back to
switch places with a party Pokémon in waiting.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage, then the user immediately switches out, and the trainer selects a replacement Pokémon from the party.  If the target faints from this attack, the user's trainer selects the new Pokémon to send out first.  If the user is the last Pokémon in its party that can battle, it will not switch out.

The user may be hit by pursuit when it switches out, if it has been targeted and pursuit has not yet been used.

This move may be used even if the user is under the effect of ingrain.  ingrain's effect will end.

machine.name: substitute
machine.description:
The user creates a substitute for itself using some of
its HP. The substitute serves as the user’s decoy.
machine.effect:
Transfers 1/4 the user's max HP into a doll that absorbs damage and causes most negative move effects to fail.  If the user leaves the field, the doll will vanish.  If the user cannot pay the HP cost, this move will fail.

The doll takes damage as normal, using the user's stats and types, and will break when its HP reaches zero.  Self-inflicted damage from confusion or recoil is not absorbed.  Healing effects from opponents ignore the doll and heal the user as normal.  Moves that work based on the user's HP still do so; the doll's HP does not influence any move.

The doll will block major status effects, confusion, and flinching.  The effects of smelling salts and wake up slap do not trigger against a doll, even if the Pokémon behind the doll has the appropriate major status effect.  Multi-turn trapping moves like wrap will hit the doll for their regular damage, but the multi-turn trapping and damage effects will not activate.

Moves blocked or damage absorbed by the doll do not count as hitting the user or inflicting damage for any effects that respond to such, e.g., avalanche, counter, or a rowap berry.  magic coat still works as normal, even against moves the doll would block.  Opposing Pokémon that damage the doll with a leech move like absorb are healed as normal.

It will also block acupressure, block, the curse effect of curse, dream eater, embargo, flatter, gastro acid, grudge, heal block, leech seed, lock on, mean look, mimic, mind reader, nightmare, pain split, psycho shift, spider web, sketch, swagger, switcheroo, trick, worry seed, and yawn.  A Pokémon affected by yawn before summoning the doll will still fall to sleep.

The doll blocks intimidate, but all other abilities act as though the doll did not exist.  If the user has an ability that absorbs moves of a certain type for HP (such as volt absorb absorbing thunder wave), such moves will not be blocked.

life orb and berries that cause confusion still work as normal, but their respective HP loss and confusion are absorbed/blocked by the doll.

The user is still vulnerable to damage inflicted when entering or leaving the field, such as by pursuit or spikes; however, the doll will block the poison effect of toxic spikes.

The doll is passed on by baton pass.  It keeps its existing HP, but uses the replacement Pokémon's stats and types for damage calculation.

All other effects work as normal.

machine.name: rock-smash
machine.description:
The user attacks with a punch. This may also lower
the target’s Defense stat.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 50% chance to lower the target's Defense by one stage.

machine.name: power-up-punch
machine.description:
Striking opponents over and over makes the user’s
fists harder. Hitting a target raises the Attack stat.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Raises the user's Attack by one stage.

level-up.name: tackle
level-up.description:
A physical attack in which the user charges and
slams into the target with its whole body.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

level-up.name: rollout
level-up.description:
The user continually rolls into the target over five
turns. It becomes more powerful each time it hits.
level-up.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  User is forced to use this move for five turns.  Power doubles every time this move is used in succession to a maximum of 16x, and resets to normal after the lock-in ends.  If this move misses or becomes unusable, the lock-in ends.

If the user has used defense curl since entering the field, this move has double power.

level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to burn the target.

This also damages the user quite a lot. This attack
may leave the target with a burn.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/3 the damage it inflicts in recoil.  Has a 10% chance to burn the target.  Frozen Pokémon may use this move, in which case they will thaw.

level-up.name: taunt
level-up.description:
The target is taunted into a rage that allows it to use
only attack moves for three turns.
level-up.effect:
Target is forced to only use damaging moves for the next 3–5 turns, selected at random.  Moves that select other moves not known in advance do not count as damaging.

assist, copycat, me first, metronome, mirror move, and sleep talk do not directly inflict damage and thus may not be used.

bide, counter, endeavor, metal burst, and mirror coat are allowed.

level-up.name: superpower
level-up.description:
The user attacks the target with great power.
However, this also lowers the user’s Attack and
Defense stats.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage, then lowers the user's Attack and Defense by one stage each.

level-up.name: overheat
level-up.description:
The user attacks the target at full power. The attack’s
recoil harshly lowers the user’s Sp. Atk stat.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage, then lowers the user's Special Attack by two stages.

egg.name: take-down
egg.description:
A reckless, full-body charge attack for slamming into
the target. This also damages the user a little.
egg.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/4 the damage it inflicts in recoil.

egg.name: focus-energy
egg.description:
The user takes a deep breath and focuses so that
critical hits land more easily.
egg.effect:
User's critical hit rate is two levels higher until it leaves the field.  If the user has already used focus energy since entering the field, this move will fail.

This effect is passed on by baton pass.

egg.name: flame-wheel
egg.description:
The user cloaks itself in fire and charges at the
target. This may also leave the target with a burn.
egg.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to burn the target.  Frozen Pokémon may use this move, in which case they will thaw.

egg.name: endure
egg.description:
The user endures any attack with at least 1 HP.
Its chance of failing rises if it is used in succession.
egg.effect:
The user's HP cannot be lowered below 1 by any means for the remainder of this turn.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick guard, or wide guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

egg.name: sleep-talk
egg.description:
While it is asleep, the user randomly uses one of the
moves it knows.
egg.effect:
Only usable if the user is sleeping.  Randomly selects and uses one of the user's other three moves.  Use of the selected move requires and costs 0 PP.

This move will not select assist, bide, bounce, chatter, copycat, dig, dive, fly, focus punch, me first, metronome, mirror move, shadow force, skull bash, sky attack, sky drop, sleep talk, solar beam, razor wind, or uproar.

If the selected move requires a recharge turn—i.e., one of blast burn, frenzy plant, giga impact, hydro cannon, hyper beam, roar of time, or rock wrecker—and the user is still sleeping next turn, then it's forced to use this move again and pay another PP for the recharge turn.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist, metronome, or sleep talk.

egg.name: encore
egg.description:
The user compels the target to keep using the move
it encored for three turns.
egg.effect:
The next 4–8 times (selected at random) the target attempts to move, it is forced to repeat its last used move.  If the selected move allows the trainer to select a target, an opponent will be selected at random each turn.  If the target is prevented from using the selected move by some other effect, struggle will be used instead.  This effect ends if the selected move runs out of PP.

If the target hasn't used a move since entering the field, if it tried to use a move this turn and failed, if it does not know the selected move, or if the selected move has 0 PP remaining, this move will fail.  If the target's last used move was encore, mimic, mirror move, sketch, struggle, or transform, this move will fail.

egg.name: focus-punch
egg.description:
The user focuses its mind before launching a punch.
This move fails if the user is hit before it is used.
egg.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  If the user takes damage this turn before hitting, this move will fail.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist, metronome, or sleep talk.

egg.name: yawn
egg.description:
The user lets loose a huge yawn that lulls the target
into falling asleep on the next turn.
egg.effect:
Puts the target to sleep at the end of the next turn.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.  If the target leaves the field, this effect is canceled.  If the target has a status effect when this move is used, this move will fail.

If the target is protected by safeguard when this move is used, this move will fail.

insomnia and vital spirit prevent the sleep if the target has either at the end of the next turn, but will not cause this move to fail on use.

egg.name: snatch
egg.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
egg.effect:
The next time a Pokémon uses a beneficial move on itself or itself and its ally this turn, the user of this move will steal the move and use it itself.  Moves which may be stolen by this move are identified by the "snatchable" flag.

If two Pokémon use this move on the same turn, the faster Pokémon will steal the first beneficial move, and the slower Pokémon will then steal it again—thus, only the slowest Pokémon using this move ultimately gains a stolen move's effect.

If the user steals psych up, it will target the Pokémon that used psych up.  If the user was the original target of psych up, and the Pokémon that originally used it's affected by pressure, it will only lose 1 PP.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist or metronome.

egg.name: extrasensory
egg.description:
The user attacks with an odd, unseeable power.
This may also make the target flinch.
egg.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to make the target flinch.

egg.name: hammer-arm
egg.description:
The user swings and hits with its strong, heavy fist.
It lowers the user’s Speed, however.
egg.effect: Inflicts regular damage, then lowers the user's Speed by one stage.

machine.name: work-up
machine.description:
The user is roused, and its Attack and Sp. Atk
stats increase.
machine.effect: Raises the user's Attack and Special Attack by one stage each.

machine.name: roar
machine.description:
The target is scared off, and a different Pokémon is
dragged out. In the wild, this ends a battle against a
single Pokémon.
machine.effect:
Switches the target out for another of its trainer's Pokémon selected at random.  Wild battles end immediately.

Doesn't affect Pokémon with suction cups or under the effect of ingrain.

machine.name: toxic
machine.description:
A move that leaves the target badly poisoned.
Its poison damage worsens every turn.
machine.effect: Badly poisons the target.  Never misses when used by a poison-type Pokémon.

machine.name: hidden-power
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's IVs.

Power is given by `x * 40 / 63 + 30`.  `x` is obtained by arranging bit 1 from the IV for each of Special Defense, Special Attack, Speed, Defense, Attack, and HP in that order.  (Bit 1 is 1 if the IV is of the form `4n + 2` or `4n + 3`.  `x` is then 64 * Special Defense IV bit 1, plus 32 * Special Attack IV bit 1, etc.)

Power is always between 30 and 70, inclusive.  Average power is 49.5.

Type is given by `y * 15 / 63`, where `y` is similar to `x` above, except constructed from bit 0.  (Bit 0 is 1 if the IV is odd.)  The result is looked up in the following table.

Value | Type
----: | --------
    0 | fighting
    1 | flying
    2 | poison
    3 | ground
    4 | rock
    5 | bug
    6 | ghost
    7 | steel
    8 | fire
    9 | water
   10 | grass
   11 | electric
   12 | psychic
   13 | ice
   14 | dragon
   15 | dark

This move thus cannot be normal.  Most other types have an equal 1/16 chance to be selected, given random IVs.  However, due to the flooring used here, bug, fighting, and grass appear 5/64 of the time, and dark only 1/64 of the time.

machine.name: confide
machine.description:
The user tells the target a secret, and the target
loses its ability to concentrate. This lowers
the target’s Sp. Atk stat.
machine.effect: Lowers the target's Special Attack by one stage.

machine.name: sunny-day
machine.description:
The user intensifies the sun for five turns, powering
up Fire-type moves. It lowers the power of
Water-type moves.
machine.effect:
Changes the weather to sunshine for five turns, during which fire moves inflict 50% extra damage, and water moves inflict half damage.

If the user is holding heat rock, this effect lasts for eight turns.

Pokémon cannot become frozen.

thunder has 50% accuracy.

solar beam skips its charge turn.

moonlight, morning sun, and synthesis heal 2/3 of the user's max HP.

Pokémon with chlorophyll have doubled original Speed.

Pokémon with forecast become fire.

Pokémon with leaf guard are not affected by major status effects.

Pokémon with flower gift change form; every Pokémon on their side of the field have their original Attack and Special Attack increased by 50%.

Pokémon with dry skin lose 1/8 max HP at the end of each turn.

Pokémon with solar power have their original Special Attack raised by 50% but lose 1/8 their max HP at the end of each turn.

machine.name: taunt
machine.description:
The target is taunted into a rage that allows it to use
only attack moves for three turns.
machine.effect:
Target is forced to only use damaging moves for the next 3–5 turns, selected at random.  Moves that select other moves not known in advance do not count as damaging.

assist, copycat, me first, metronome, mirror move, and sleep talk do not directly inflict damage and thus may not be used.

bide, counter, endeavor, metal burst, and mirror coat are allowed.

machine.name: protect
machine.description:
This move enables the user to protect itself from
all attacks. Its chance of failing rises if it is used
in succession.
machine.effect:
No moves will hit the user for the remainder of this turn.  If the user is last to act this turn, this move will fail.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick guard, or wide guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

lock on, mind reader, and no guard provide a (100 – accuracy)% chance for moves to break through this move.  This does not apply to one-hit KO moves (fissure, guillotine, horn drill, and sheer cold); those are always blocked by this move.

thunder during rain dance and blizzard during hail have a 30% chance to break through this move.

The following effects are not prevented by this move:

* acupressure from an ally
* curse's curse effect
* Delayed damage from doom desire and future sight; however, these moves will be prevented if they are used this turn
* feint, which will also end this move's protection after it hits
* imprison
* perish song
* shadow force
* Moves that merely copy the user, such as transform or psych up

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

machine.name: frustration
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases inversely with happiness, given by `(255 - happiness) * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

machine.name: solar-beam
machine.description:
In this two-turn attack, the user gathers light, then
blasts a bundled beam on the next turn.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  User charges for one turn before attacking.

During sunny day, the charge turn is skipped.

During hail, rain dance, or sandstorm, power is halved.

This move cannot be selected by sleep talk.

machine.name: return
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with happiness, given by `happiness * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

machine.name: brick-break
machine.description:
The user attacks with a swift chop. It can also break
barriers, such as Light Screen and Reflect.
machine.effect: Destroys any light screen or reflect on the target's side of the field, then inflicts regular damage.

machine.name: double-team
machine.description:
By moving rapidly, the user makes illusory copies of
itself to raise its evasiveness.
machine.effect: Raises the user's evasion by one stage.

machine.name: flamethrower
machine.description:
The target is scorched with an intense blast of fire.
This may also leave the target with a burn.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to burn the target.

machine.name: fire-blast
machine.description:
The target is attacked with an intense blast of
all-consuming fire. This may also leave the target
with a burn.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to burn the target.

machine.name: rock-tomb
machine.description:
Boulders are hurled at the target. This also lowers
the target’s Speed stat by preventing its movement.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Speed by one stage.

machine.name: facade
machine.description:
This attack move doubles its power if the user is
poisoned, burned, or paralyzed.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If the user is burned, paralyzed, or poisoned, this move has double power.

machine.name: flame-charge
machine.description:
Cloaking itself in flame, the user attacks the target.
Then, building up more power, the user raises its
Speed stat.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Raises the user's Speed by one stage.

machine.name: rest
machine.description:
The user goes to sleep for two turns. This fully
restores the user’s HP and heals any
status conditions.
machine.effect:
User falls to sleep and immediately regains all its HP.  If the user has another major status effect, sleep will replace it.  The user will always wake up after two turns, or one turn with early bird.

This move fails if the Pokémon cannot fall asleep due to uproar, insomnia, or vital spirit.  It also fails if the Pokémon is at full health or is already asleep.

machine.name: attract
machine.description:
If it is the opposite gender of the user, the target
becomes infatuated and less likely to attack.
machine.effect: Causes the target to fall in love with the user, giving it a 50% chance to do nothing each turn.  If the user and target are the same gender, or either is genderless, this move will fail.  If either Pokémon leaves the field, this effect ends.

machine.name: thief
machine.description:
The user attacks and steals the target’s held item
simultaneously. The user can’t steal anything if it
already holds an item.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is holding an item and the user is not, the user will permanently take the item.  Damage is still inflicted if an item cannot be taken.

Pokémon with sticky hold or multitype are immune to the item theft effect.

The target cannot recover its item with recycle.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

machine.name: round
machine.description:
The user attacks the target with a song. Others can
join in the Round to increase the power of
the attack.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If round has already been used this turn, this move's power is doubled.  After this move is used, any other Pokémon using it this turn will immediately do so (in the order they would otherwise act), regardless of Speed or priority.  Pokémon using other moves will then continue to act as usual.

machine.name: overheat
machine.description:
The user attacks the target at full power. The attack’s
recoil harshly lowers the user’s Sp. Atk stat.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage, then lowers the user's Special Attack by two stages.

machine.name: fling
machine.description:
The user flings its held item at the target to attack.
This move’s power and effects depend on the item.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's held item.  The item is consumed.  If the user is not holding an item, or its item has no set type and power, this move will fail.

This move ignores sticky hold.

If the user is under the effect of embargo, this move will fail.

machine.name: will-o-wisp
machine.description:
The user shoots a sinister flame at the target to inflict
a burn.
machine.effect: Burns the target.

machine.name: gyro-ball
machine.description:
The user tackles the target with a high-speed spin.
The slower the user compared to the target, the
greater the move’s power.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with the target's current Speed compared to the user, given by `1 + 25 * target Speed / user Speed`, capped at 150.

machine.name: rock-slide
machine.description:
Large boulders are hurled at opposing Pokémon to
inflict damage. This may also make the opposing
Pokémon flinch.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

machine.name: grass-knot
machine.description:
The user snares the target with grass and trips it.
The heavier the target, the greater the
move’s power.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with the target's weight in kilograms, to a maximum of 120.

Target's weight | Power
--------------- | ----:
Up to 10kg      |    20
Up to 25kg      |    40
Up to 50kg      |    60
Up to 100kg     |    80
Up to 200kg     |   100
Above 200kg     |   120

machine.name: swagger
machine.description:
The user enrages and confuses the target. However,
this also sharply raises the target’s Attack stat.
machine.effect: Raises the target's Attack by two stages, then confuses it.  If the target's Attack cannot be raised by two stages, the confusion is not applied.

machine.name: sleep-talk
machine.description:
While it is asleep, the user randomly uses one of the
moves it knows.
machine.effect:
Only usable if the user is sleeping.  Randomly selects and uses one of the user's other three moves.  Use of the selected move requires and costs 0 PP.

This move will not select assist, bide, bounce, chatter, copycat, dig, dive, fly, focus punch, me first, metronome, mirror move, shadow force, skull bash, sky attack, sky drop, sleep talk, solar beam, razor wind, or uproar.

If the selected move requires a recharge turn—i.e., one of blast burn, frenzy plant, giga impact, hydro cannon, hyper beam, roar of time, or rock wrecker—and the user is still sleeping next turn, then it's forced to use this move again and pay another PP for the recharge turn.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist, metronome, or sleep talk.

machine.name: u-turn
machine.description:
After making its attack, the user rushes back to
switch places with a party Pokémon in waiting.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage, then the user immediately switches out, and the trainer selects a replacement Pokémon from the party.  If the target faints from this attack, the user's trainer selects the new Pokémon to send out first.  If the user is the last Pokémon in its party that can battle, it will not switch out.

The user may be hit by pursuit when it switches out, if it has been targeted and pursuit has not yet been used.

This move may be used even if the user is under the effect of ingrain.  ingrain's effect will end.

machine.name: substitute
machine.description:
The user creates a substitute for itself using some of
its HP. The substitute serves as the user’s decoy.
machine.effect:
Transfers 1/4 the user's max HP into a doll that absorbs damage and causes most negative move effects to fail.  If the user leaves the field, the doll will vanish.  If the user cannot pay the HP cost, this move will fail.

The doll takes damage as normal, using the user's stats and types, and will break when its HP reaches zero.  Self-inflicted damage from confusion or recoil is not absorbed.  Healing effects from opponents ignore the doll and heal the user as normal.  Moves that work based on the user's HP still do so; the doll's HP does not influence any move.

The doll will block major status effects, confusion, and flinching.  The effects of smelling salts and wake up slap do not trigger against a doll, even if the Pokémon behind the doll has the appropriate major status effect.  Multi-turn trapping moves like wrap will hit the doll for their regular damage, but the multi-turn trapping and damage effects will not activate.

Moves blocked or damage absorbed by the doll do not count as hitting the user or inflicting damage for any effects that respond to such, e.g., avalanche, counter, or a rowap berry.  magic coat still works as normal, even against moves the doll would block.  Opposing Pokémon that damage the doll with a leech move like absorb are healed as normal.

It will also block acupressure, block, the curse effect of curse, dream eater, embargo, flatter, gastro acid, grudge, heal block, leech seed, lock on, mean look, mimic, mind reader, nightmare, pain split, psycho shift, spider web, sketch, swagger, switcheroo, trick, worry seed, and yawn.  A Pokémon affected by yawn before summoning the doll will still fall to sleep.

The doll blocks intimidate, but all other abilities act as though the doll did not exist.  If the user has an ability that absorbs moves of a certain type for HP (such as volt absorb absorbing thunder wave), such moves will not be blocked.

life orb and berries that cause confusion still work as normal, but their respective HP loss and confusion are absorbed/blocked by the doll.

The user is still vulnerable to damage inflicted when entering or leaving the field, such as by pursuit or spikes; however, the doll will block the poison effect of toxic spikes.

The doll is passed on by baton pass.  It keeps its existing HP, but uses the replacement Pokémon's stats and types for damage calculation.

All other effects work as normal.
